intro: Tephroseris helenitis subsp. macrochaeta, commonly known as the Helen’s tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and grass-like leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, hairy phyllaries and yellow disk flowers. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in full sun. This plant is often found in open habitats such as coastal cliffs and dry meadows.
